habitat_description:
The graphic spiny lizard is found in southern Texas and also in northern Mexico (Garcia-Prieto et al. 2000). In Mexico, the exact locations of occurrence remain unknown, while the populations found in Texas are restricted to the lowermost region of the Rio Grande.

This arboreal lizard is commonly found in cropland, hedgerows, mixed woodland, chaparral, shrubland, and in arid to semiarid habitats. It is associated with large mesquite trees, oaks, and other trees found in dry, sparsely vegetated areas (Bartlett and Bartlett 1999; Smith 1946).

Associated with large mesquite, oak, nopaleras (cacti plantations) and other trees found in arid to semiarid areas of Texas.
